channel.title: RSPS on a Raspberry pi?
channel.description:
Hey guys,
I have a question about running a RSPS on a Raspberry Pi. Is that even possible? And if it is possible how?
greetz,
Judotesterk

item.title: RSPS on a Raspberry pi?
item.dc:creator: @judotesterk judotesterk
item.description:
@judotesterk wrote:

[quote=“MyNameIsDylan, post:8, topic:540140”]It’s possible. My brother was actually telling me about this the other day. It’s not a good alternative to your typical dedicated host, but it is possible. I’ll get more info from my brother and elaborate on it more for you-when I get a chance. But for now, this should help you out some what.

http://www.raspberrypi.org/phpBB3/viewtopic.php?t=6870&p=286180

Mind you, he’s saying that w/ RuneScape (Jagex’ version) wouldn’t work too well, of course he is talking about the newer revision’s. But I know for a fact you can implement an earlier revision to work just fine.[/quote]

i am trying to get 317 running but i guess i got a wrong source because i got error about the script and not the rest

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS on a Raspberry pi?
item.dc:creator: @MyNameIsDylan MyNameIsDylan
item.description:
@MyNameIsDylan wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:9, topic:540140”][quote author=MyNameIsDylan link=topic=658991.msg4407658#msg4407658 date=1392509780]
It’s possible. My brother was actually telling me about this the other day. It’s not a good alternative to your typical dedicated host, but it is possible. I’ll get more info from my brother and elaborate on it more for you-when I get a chance. But for now, this should help you out some what.

http://www.raspberrypi.org/phpBB3/viewtopic.php?t=6870&p=286180

Mind you, he’s saying that w/ RuneScape (Jagex’ version) wouldn’t work too well, of course he is talking about the newer revision’s. But I know for a fact you can implement an earlier revision to work just fine.
[/quote]People struggle to run servers on dedicated hosts with a few GBs of RAM and heavyweight Intel CPUs. Trying to run a server on a raspberry pi will be nothing more than a mildly interesting learning experience.[/quote]

Agreed, but it could be a efficient way to edit files for your source. With the proper set-up.

Read full topic

[quote=“MyNameIsDylan, post:8, topic:540140”]It’s possible. My brother was actually telling me about this the other day. It’s not a good alternative to your typical dedicated host, but it is possible. I’ll get more info from my brother and elaborate on it more for you-when I get a chance. Mind you, he’s saying that w/ RuneScape (Jagex’ version) wouldn’t work too well, of course he is talking about the newer revision’s. But I know for a fact you can implement an earlier revision to work just fine.[/quote]People struggle to run servers on dedicated hosts with a few GBs of RAM and heavyweight Intel CPUs. Trying to run a server on a raspberry pi will be nothing more than a mildly interesting learning experience.

item.title: RSPS on a Raspberry pi?
item.dc:creator: @MyNameIsDylan MyNameIsDylan
item.description:
@MyNameIsDylan wrote:

It’s possible. My brother was actually telling me about this the other day. It’s not a good alternative to your typical dedicated host, but it is possible. I’ll get more info from my brother and elaborate on it more for you-when I get a chance. But for now, this should help you out some what.

http://www.raspberrypi.org/phpBB3/viewtopic.php?t=6870&p=286180

Mind you, he’s saying that w/ RuneScape (Jagex’ version) wouldn’t work too well, of course he is talking about the newer revision’s. But I know for a fact you can implement an earlier revision to work just fine.

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS on a Raspberry pi?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“xx matty xx, post:6, topic:540140”]I’ve run Java apps on my RPI pretty easily, but yeah gl allocating your server its 40GB heap.

(back in the day, you’d install debian wheezy and just get java using the package manager. not sure if wheezy is still the best distro to use)[/quote]
Matter of personal preference. All of them have a java package with hard float enabled nowadays

Read full topic

item.title: RSPS on a Raspberry pi?
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

I’ve run Java apps on my RPI pretty easily, but yeah gl allocating your server its 40GB heap.

(back in the day, you’d install debian wheezy and just get java using the package manager. not sure if wheezy is still the best distro to use)
